content.body: Yeah, nice work by timothygu and twiss
content.formatted_body: Yeah, nice work by timothygu and twiss

content.body: I didn't realize infinities were converted to 0 when cast to a WebIDL integer type
I was trying to do `setTimeout(fn, a ? Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY : 10 * 1000)`
content.formatted_body: I was trying to do setTimeout(fn, a ? Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY : 10 * 1000)

content.body: * I was trying to do `setTimeout(fn, timeout ? 10 * 1000 : Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY)`
content.formatted_body: * I was trying to do setTimeout(fn, timeout ? 10 * 1000 : Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY)

m.new_content.body: I was trying to do `setTimeout(fn, timeout ? 10 * 1000 : Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY)`
m.new_content.formatted_body: I was trying to do setTimeout(fn, timeout ? 10 * 1000 : Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY)

content.body:
per-spec should the following be a document-conformance (authoring-conformance error)?
```html
<input type='text' autocomplete=' ' />
```
content.formatted_body:
per-spec should the following be a document-conformance (authoring-conformance error)?

<input type='text' autocomplete=' ' />

content.body: https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/7049 could use some help/attention from someone among us with strong domain knowledge (and strong opinionsâ€¦) about Shadow DOM

> <@sideshowbarker:mozilla.org> per-spec should the following be a document-conformance (authoring-conformance error)?
> ```html
> <input type='text' autocomplete=' ' />
> ```

I believe it should per the authoring conformance requirements in https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#attr-fe-autocomplete
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @sideshowbarker:mozilla.org

per-spec should the following be a document-conformance (authoring-conformance error)?

<input type='text' autocomplete=' ' />
I believe it should per the authoring conformance requirements in https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#attr-fe-autocomplete

content.body: Hmm nope https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/common-microsyntaxes.html#set-of-space-separated-tokens did not say what I thought it said
So it seems like both autocomplete="" and autocomplete=" " should be valid?
